group_1.textRight: So how's Mami doing?

group_1.textLeft: She's gained significant power via mixing@her Magical Girl magic with Uwasa magic.
It was a most fortuitous idea to robe her in@the Uwasa itself.
Though she isn't fully stable yet.

group_1.textRight: Well, Mami's a powerful Magical Girl.
Controlling her is not that easy.

group_1.textLeft: But it's only a matter of time.
I've already used up a lifetime's worth@of energy, after all.

group_1.textRight: Well I, Alina, only need her to lead all the@Magical Girls.
I ask for nothing more.

group_1.textLeft: I'm not especially worried about Mami, but@are you okay?

group_1.textRight: Me?
I have no recollection of dressing up in an@Uwasa like she has.

group_1.textLeft: That's not what I mean! You've been in a@lousy mood lately, right?
You seem back to your old self today.

group_1.textRight: Yes, because I solved the issue at its root.
Well, perhaps "solved" is going too far.

group_1.textLeft: I can't exactly relate to your circumstances,@but I'm glad you've calmed down.
I was starting to worry you might take out@your anger on the Wings of the Magius.

group_1.textRight: "Take out my anger"... Just what kind of girl@do you think I am?
Besides, I was sincerely concerned about@something!

group_1.textLeft: Your normal behavior sets a precedent.
And we don't know what you were up to so@it's only natural that we don't understand.

group_1.textRight: You'd still have no idea even if I told you.

group_1.textLeft: That's not true... Right, Nemu?

group_1.textRight: I don't feel any pressing urge to ask about@it anyway.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, but I'm interested! I don't think of @Alina as the type to worry.

group_1.textRight: You little...
Fine.
If you insist on mocking me then I will@tell you all of it, from the beginning.

group_1.textLeft: Hmm...the "core" that powers your work...

group_1.textRight: Yes. I want to know what lies at the heart@of my art, beyond the theme.
I've never read this manga that brought@you to this realization, but...
It must be something that reaches you on a@deeper level than human consciousness.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah.
If it was just about how emotions occur,@I can explain how the amygdala works...
But when it comes to why you feel those@emotions in the first place...
We need to think of the origin of emotions@itself.
It could be something that got etched into@our DNA over countless generations.
Like the cells that make our heart continue@beating even without a brain.
It could be difficult to find a clear answer@to this one...

group_1.textRight: You actually understood what I said?

group_1.textLeft: Don't underestimate a child prodigy.
I have an adequate enough understanding@as well.

group_1.textRight: I apologize.
In that case, I'm glad I told you.
I would love to hear any guidance you may@have.

group_1.textLeft: Well...
I would consider it from the angle that all@individuals find enjoyment in the same way.
The theory of a "collective unconsciousness"@combines all perspectives in this way, too.

group_1.textRight: What's that?

group_1.textLeft: A universal concept that resides not in the@mind of the individual, but of the masses.
A good example is how the sun is deified by@peoples from different nations worldwide.
They had no way of sharing their ideas, but@each viewed the sun as divine organically.
It is a shared mode of unconscious thought@that traverses the vast borders of humanity.
You could consider that line of thought too.

group_1.textRight: So you are saying that fascination, as a@concept, is shared unconsciously by humans?

group_1.textLeft: It's not out of the realm of possibility.

group_1.textRight: Then that means that when I, Alina, create@my artwork...
And everyone is entranced by them... When@they evaluate them, they're really...

group_1.textLeft: Oh!
I know the perfect word for you, Alina!

group_1.textRight: And what is that?

group_1.textLeft: Destrudo!

group_1.textRight: What?

group_1.textLeft: A death drive, a self-destructive urge.
*Giggle*

group_1.textRight: A self-destructive urge...?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, an urge. Like a craving.
Like when you're hungry or tired.
These unconscious urges occur all the time@as humans go about their lives.
This "death drive" is an urge that draws you@towards death.
Perhaps it's because of that very urge,@Alina.
That's what's unconsciously affecting your@artwork.

group_1.textRight: So the core of my work would be...a craving@towards death?
